poem:
Title: "Reshuffle in the Grove of Governance"

In this gory mire of power-play,
Halfon and Heappey depart,
Their footprints fade in corridors of grey -
A brisk reshuffle's start.

Dreamt visas granted to phantoms at the gate,
275 clerical mistakes consecrate.
Sunak denies the debts of state,
Whilst councils teeter on the precipice of fate.
